summary: A November 5, 2021 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, detailing the production of additional witness materials including Jencks Act and Giglio disclosures. The letter indicates the government is providing materials for both potential trial witnesses and individuals not currently intended to be called, with specific protective order designations.

persons.name: Damian Williams

events.title: Government Production of Witness Materials
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office produces additional Jencks Act and Giglio materials to defense counsel in the Ghislaine Maxwell case, including materials for both potential trial witnesses and individuals not currently intended to be called.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the Ghislaine Maxwell case governing the handling of confidential materials.

Cohen & Gresser LLP, 800 Third Avenue, New York, NY 10022

keyFacts: The government produced Jencks Act and Giglio materials for witnesses who may testify at Ghislaine Maxwell's trial, as well as materials for individuals not currently intended to be called.
The production is governed by a protective order dated July 31, 2020, with specific confidentiality designations to avoid confusion with classified document markings.
The letter explicitly states the government reserves the right to call individuals listed as not currently intended to be witnesses, indicating potential changes in trial strategy.
The document reveals multiple defense attorneys representing Ghislaine Maxwell across different law firms in New York and Denver.
The U.S. Attorney's Office, under Damian Williams, is handling the prosecution and evidence disclosure process.
